title: Bangladesh and India swap detained fishermen
body: Indian authorities today handed over 32 Bangladeshi fishermen, who were detained in India on various occasions, to the Bangladesh authorities. On the other hand, Bangladesh handed over 47 Indian fishermen who were detained by Bangladeshis authorities, said Bangladesh's foreign ministry. The repatriation took place on the International Maritime Boundary Line in the Bay of Bengal today. Simultaneously, the Indian Coast Guard returned one Bangladeshi-owned fishing boat, while the Bangladesh Coast Guard returned three Indian-owned fishing boats, the foreign ministry said in a statement. The repatriation process has been implemented through the coordinated efforts of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Home Affairs, Ministry of Fisheries and Livestock, Ministry of Shipping, Bangladesh Coast Guard, Border Guard Bangladesh, Bangladesh Police, local administration, and other relevant agencies.
